gui.analysis.corrupted_config_finder.hea:
Scans configuration folders (config, defaultconfigs, and every world's serverconfig) and reports configuration files that are empty or invalid.
Use it when the game ignores configuration changes or fails because of bad config files.
gui.analysis.corrupted_config_finder.no_: No corrupted configuration files were detected.
No corrupted configuration files were found.
gui.analysis.corrupted_jar_finder.header:
Scans every mod JAR (including nested jars) and reports archives that are empty or corrupted.
Use it when the game fails to load certain mods or silently ignores them.
gui.analysis.corrupted_jar_finder.no_iss: No corrupted JAR files were found.
gui.analysis.corrupted_jar_finder.reason: File does not exist at the expected path.
Expected a regular file but found something else.

gui.analysis.dependencies.jdk_required_m: A JDK is required for the analysis of jar files. The JRE is not sufficient for this! We looked at JAVA_HOME, the jdeps command, and the Java used to launch the game, but we couldn't find anything. You can either: 1. Install the Oracle JDK 21 via winget 2. Select an existing JDK installation directory 3. Close this dialog and install a JDK manually from: $ADOPTIUM_JDK_LINK$ Make sure to check the JAVA_HOME check box in the installation settings. After you've done that, try running the analysis again.

gui.analysis.jdeps.header:
Scans mods to find which ones depend on or using a specific class or package.
This is especially helpful if you see NoClassDefFoundError or ClassNotFoundException in your logs
and don't know which mod requires that missing class.
gui.analysis.jdeps.include_nested: Include nested jars (jarInJar) in the analysis. Disabling can speed up the analysis but won't detect some rare cases.
gui.analysis.jdeps.input_message:
Enter a class or package to search for dependencies (case-insensitive).
Supported formats:
- simple class name like 'IMPConfig' or 'OkHttpClient$Builder'
- fully qualified class name like 'org.mozilla.javascript.BoundFunction'
- package name like 'org.mozilla.javascript' (matches everything under this package)
gui.analysis.jdeps.not_found: No usage of '$TERM$' found in any mod.
gui.analysis.jdeps.restart_prompt: Do you want to restart the analysis to apply this setting?
gui.analysis.mcreator_detector.header: Scans for mods made with MCreator.
gui.analysis.mcreator_detector.why_butto: Why are MCreator mods often discouraged?
gui.analysis.mcreator_detector.why_info:
MCreator is a tool used to create Minecraft mods without programming knowledge. However, mods produced with it very often contain problematic issues that don't appear in other projects:

1) The generated code most of the time does wrapping and unwrapping for no reason
2) The generated code sometimes uses reflection without any reason
3) The generated code sometimes uses code that breaks other mods (for example, world generation)
4) The generated code uses sets of classes, nested classes, annotations, and similar structures that often make no sense whatsoever
5) The generated code doesn't follow correct Forge or Fabric best practices
6) The generated code is sometimes completely unreadable
7) What happens if you crash? Or if you need to do something MCreator doesn't know how to do?
gui.analysis.no_detected_mods: No detected mods to act on.
gui.analysis.package_finder.header:
Scans mods to find which ones contain the specified package or class.
This can help identify which mod provides a specific resource.
gui.analysis.package_finder.input_messag:
Enter a class or package to search for inside mods (case-insensitive).
Supported formats:
- simple class name like 'IMPConfig' or 'OkHttpClient$Builder'
- fully qualified class name like 'org.mozilla.javascript.BoundFunction'
- package name like 'org.mozilla.javascript' (matches everything under this package)
gui.analysis.package_finder.not_found: Class or package '$TERM$' not found in any mod.

Registry Details: Key: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\DirectX\UserGpuPreferences Name: $JAVA_PATH$ Data: GpuPreference=2; This operation doesn't require administrator rights and only affects your personal settings. Do you want to proceed?

gui.intel_corrupted_microcode_bad: Your current microcode version is $MICROCODE_VERSION_CURRENT$, which is lower than the recommended version $MICROCODE_VERSION_FIXED$. Running on outdated microcode can lead to system instability and risks damage to your CPU over time. It is highly recommended to update your BIOS/UEFI as soon as possible to apply the fix from Intel.
gui.intel_corrupted_microcode_good:
Your current microcode version is $MICROCODE_VERSION_CURRENT$, which satisfies the minimum recommended version $MICROCODE_VERSION_FIXED$.
Your system has the necessary microcode fix from Intel. However, if you had previously experienced or are experiencing system instability (such as BSODs or random application crashes), please continue to monitor your hardware's stability: the CPU may have already been damaged by running an outdated microcode version.
gui.intel_corrupted_msg:
Warning: Your CPU model may be affected by a known Intel chip degradation issue. If you are not familiar with this issue, you may read this $LINK.INTEL_CHIP_BUG_FAQ$ for more details. $CURRENT_MICROCODE_TEXT$ Before reporting this crash, please verify the following:
  • Update your BIOS/UEFI: Check if you are running an outdated microcode version and update if necessary.
  • Rule out this hardware bug as the cause: System instability (BSODs, random application crashes) can be a symptom of this issue. A BIOS/UEFI update can prevent further damage but won't fix hardware that is already damaged.
  • Check your warranty: If you suspect the CPU is damaged due to this issue, contact your system manufacturer or Intel about a replacement. Intel has extended the warranty for some affected processors.

gui.privacy.consent_not_given: You have not given consent to the Privacy Policy, or it has already been revoked.
gui.privacy.consent_reset_success: Privacy Policy consent has been reset successfully.
gui.privacy.crash_assistant_privacy_poli:
This Privacy Policy explains how the Crash Assistant team (We, Us, Our) handles personal data of the User (You, Your) when using Crash Assistant. This Privacy Policy may be available in multiple languages; in case of any discrepancies or conflicts, the English version is authoritative.

Crash Assistant

Crash Assistant is a Minecraft mod that processes Your personal data (such as logs) entirely locally on Your system, limited to what is necessary to provide the functionality described in the $LINK.CRASH_ASSISTANT$. Crash Assistant itself is entirely client-side: it does not run servers and never receives a copy of Your logs. If You do not even want Crash Assistant to process Your personal data locally, close it and remove it from the mods folder. The creator, operator, and data controller for Crash Assistant is Daniil Averin (KostromDan). You can contact Us on Our $LINK.CRASH_ASSISTANT_DISCORD$ in the crash-assistant channel, or by sending a direct message to @KostromDan. If You want to use e-mail, You can contact Us at kostromdanlegal@gmail.com. Furthermore, according to §77 GDPR, You have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority if You believe that the processing of Your personal data is illicit. The following sections discuss Our log uploading functionality.

gnomebot.dev

Because mclo.gs' mobile UI can be inconvenient, We wrap the returned URL through gnomebot.dev by default: https://mclo.gs/X → https://gnomebot.dev/paste/mclogs/X. You can disable this behavior in the config. Currently enabled: $GNOMEBOT_ENABLED$ gnomebot.dev is an open-source online log viewer; it fetches data from mclo.gs, displays it with convenient formatting, and caches the paste in RAM for five minutes after the last access before discarding it. gnomebot.dev is created and operated by Kristiāns Micītis (Latvian Modder). You can contact him on his $LINK.LAT_DISCORD$. We are completely independent from gnomebot.dev. Unless You or someone else opens the copied link, gnomebot.dev will not know Your log exists.

mclo.gs

Only when You explicitly click one of the 'Upload' buttons, logs are uploaded to mclo.gs, a log-sharing service operated by Aternos GmbH (Germany), using secure (HTTPS) methods. Before publishing, mclo.gs automatically tries to redact sensitive information, such as access tokens, IP addresses, or computer usernames. However, mclo.gs cannot guarantee that this always works flawlessly. Only data that can be used to harm You is attempted to be removed. This is not anonymizing! Minecraft usernames, UUIDs, hardware details, and other information that may be personal are retained, because this often helps determine the cause of a crash. If You believe any information is being retained unnecessarily, please contact mclo.gs. Any log uploaded to mclo.gs is stored on their servers for up to 90 days after the last access. After that, the log is deleted automatically. More information on retention periods, access rights, data redaction, contact details, and Your GDPR rights, such as log erasure, data access, correction, restriction, portability, objection, and the right to complain, is available in their $LINK.MCLOGS_PRIVACY_POLICY$. We are completely independent from mclo.gs; We only use their public API to help You share Your logs.

Consent Reset

To withdraw Your consent at any time, open the $LANG.gui.menu.privacy$ menu → $LANG.gui.menu.privacy.reset_consent$. Warning: withdrawing Your consent only affects future log uploads, where You will need to grant consent again. This action does not remove logs that have already been uploaded to mclo.gs; You must contact them directly for deletion. Also, this action does not interrupt uploads that are currently running; if You want to interrupt them, close Crash Assistant instead, although often, with normal internet connection speed, logs are uploaded almost immediately. Some logs or parts of the logs might have already been uploaded, so if You believe that some information You would not like to share has already been uploaded, You may wait for the upload to complete and contact mclo.gs for deletion, providing the links to the logs You want to remove.

Consent Validity

By clicking Accept in the dialog before uploading a log, You consent to the processing of Your data for the purpose of uploading logs. We only process Your data on the basis of Your freely given consent. Uploading logs is completely voluntary; declining to upload them will not affect Crash Assistant's local functionality. If the $LANG.gui.privacy.remember_my_choice$ checkbox is selected, Your consent will be stored locally on Your system in the 'local/crash_assistant/local_config.json' file, relative to the folder of this modpack, and will be applied as long as that file exists or until You revoke Your consent. If the checkbox is not selected, consent will apply only until the GUI is closed or the consent is revoked. We may update this Privacy Policy. The current version is always available at the top of the Privacy Policy text in the $LANG.gui.menu.privacy$ menu → $LANG.gui.menu.privacy.logs_info$. When a new version of this Privacy Policy is introduced in an update, You will be prompted to review and reaccept it before uploading any logs.

Upload Volume

You decide which logs to upload and for what purpose. We only provide a convenient GUI for this. Clicking the $LANG.gui.upload_and_copy_link_button$ button next to a single entry sends only that specific log. Clicking $LANG.gui.upload_all_button$ sends every log listed under $LANG.gui.file_list_label$ plus the mods-difference file. The copied message may contain additional context; please review it before sharing.
gui.privacy.declined: Cannot upload log because you declined the Privacy Policy.
gui.privacy.logs_upload_question: Do you accept the $LINK.PRIVACY_POLICY$ for uploading logs?
gui.privacy.logs_upload_question_changed: The Privacy Policy has changed. Please review the new text before accepting.
gui.privacy.title: Privacy Information
gui.too_many_changes_warning_drop_suppor:
You've made too many changes to the modpack!
Most likely, this issue is caused by your modifications.
Clicking the "Update All" button in the launcher is also very likely to break things.

If you haven't modified the modpack, most likely it's corrupted due to an incorrect update, and you should reinstall it.

We won't provide support for that number of changes ($MODIFICATIONS_COUNT$).
Please revert all your changes, or you're on your own!
gui.too_many_changes_warning_notice:
Notice: You've made a large number of changes to the modpack ($MODIFICATIONS_COUNT$).
Adding random mods into an already balanced pack is expected to cause issues and crashes.
Clicking the "Update All" button in the launcher is also very likely to break things.
Please add new mods in small batches and make sure to test everything carefully.
Before asking for support, try reverting or reducing your changes.
If the problem still happens with fewer or no changes, feel free to reach out for help.

If you haven't modified the modpack, most likely it's corrupted due to an incorrect update, and you should reinstall it.

warnings_common.drivers: You probably have to update your graphics drivers to solve the crash: 1. Identify your graphics card The GPU currently used to run this instance of Minecraft is: $CURRENT_GPU$ if you already know, skip to the next step - Open Task Manager - Navigate to the 'Performance' tab (on Windows 11 this is the button that looks like a heart pulse) - Press the GPU 0 graph and read your GPU from the top right Note: You may see a GPU 0 and GPU 1. This means you have an integrated GPU in the CPU, as well as a dedicated GPU. You probably want GPU 1 (usually the better one), but you can ask staff to clarify if necessary. 2. Download your drivers from the manufacturer's site You likely need drivers from either AMD, Intel, or NVIDIA, depending on your GPU AMD: $LINK.AMD_SUPPORT$ Intel: $LINK.INTEL_DRIVERS$ NVIDIA: $LINK.NVIDIA_DRIVERS$ Note: - For NVIDIA you want to select 'Game Ready Driver (GRD)' (the default option) for the best performance. Once installed, you may want to download GeForce Experience, which will notify you when an update to drivers is available. - For Intel, you may want to press 'Get Started' under the 'Automatically update your drivers and software', which will simplify the process and update drivers automatically. - For AMD you may want to press 'Download Windows Drivers', which will download AMD Adrenaline to update your drivers automatically. 3. Run the installation, restart your computer, and try playing MC again - At this point, hopefully, Minecraft is working. If it still doesn't, contact support with the report from the $LANG.gui.upload_all_comment$ button.
warnings_common.so_vm_options: Note: Make sure to add '-XX:+UnlockExperimentalVMOptions' to the top, and the path arguments to the bottom of the Java arguments section.
warnings.0x0000: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ that this crash is caused by an issue inside the GPU driver. To fix it, follow these instructions: $LANG.warnings_common.drivers$
warnings.alc_cleanup: The AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed error in $LOG_FILENAME$ indicates an issue with the OpenAL audio library. This is a known bug that sometimes occurs. To fix this, add the following JVM argument: -Xms2G Make sure not to confuse -Xms with -Xmx. If the -Xms argument is already present in your JVM arguments, modify it instead of adding a new one.
warnings.atio6axx: The atio6axx 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is part of the AMD driver for the GPU. There is a bad version of the AMD drivers that instantly crashes on an OpenGL task. Try fresh reinstalling your drivers from $LINK.AMD_SUPPORT$ If you don't have an AMD GPU, then you need to tell your system to use that GPU instead of the integrated GPU of the AMD CPU, steps below. $LINK.HOW_FORCE_APP_USE_DISCRETE_GPU$
warnings.c6a: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ of missing Create mod classes, and the Create mod is currently installed. Create Update 6 was released recently, but some addons (either standard addons or mods with Create compatibility) may be mismatched: - Create Update 5 with addons for Update 6, or - Create Update 6 with addons for Update 5. You must ensure that all Create-related mods are either from Update 5 or Update 6. Note that release dates are not always a reliable way to determine compatibility. This may be a false alarm, so please double-check. To identify which mods are incompatible with your current version of the Create mod: Click the $LANG.gui.analysis.find_incompatible_create_addons$ button below. Wait for the analysis to complete, then you will see a list of mods incompatible with the installed version of Create.
warnings.closed_by_windows: If this crash happened while loading or closing the game or a level, it was likely caused by pressing keys or clicking the mouse. The error 'The program javaw.exe version ... stopped interacting with Windows and was closed' in $LOG_FILENAME$ means that the game froze. To avoid this, try letting the game load/close fully: DO NOT CLICK ANYTHING, DO NOT PRESS ANY KEY, DO NOT CLICK END PROCESS. If the crash occurred during gameplay, just press OK and ignore this message.
warnings.codex: Codex Logs Analyzer found a potential reason for this crash at $LINE$ of $LOG_FILENAME$: Problem: $PROBLEM$ Solution(s): $SOLUTIONS$
warnings.codex_crash_assistant_comment: Crash Assistant comment on this issue:
warnings.codex_erroring_entity: If this happened on an unmodified modpack, consider reporting it to the modpack authors, as this shouldn't happen. To remove the block or entity causing the error, you can try temporarily installing the Neruina mod. This won't fix the cause of the issue, but it will let you join the world and remove the problematic entity or block. For Forge and NeoForge, there is an alternative way: Forge: go to 'world/serverconfig/forge-server.toml' (where 'world' is the name of your world) NeoForge: go to config/neoforge-server.toml Enable the appropriate option, depending on what is causing the error: Set removeErroringBlockEntities = true to remove any BlockEntity that throws an error in its update method. Set removeErroringEntities = true to remove any Entity that throws an error in its tick method.
warnings.connector_incompatible_fabric_m:
Seems like you are trying to run one or more Fabric mods with $LINK.CONNECTOR$.
Unfortunately, this is not compatible with the mods listed below:
To resolve this crash, remove the mods listed above or replace them with the recommended alternatives.
$MOD_ID$. Unfortunately, there is no known native Forge alternative for this mod. You will have to remove it.
$MOD_ID$, but there is no reason to use it because a native Forge version exists: $ALTERNATIVE$
warnings.corrupted_mod_jar: We detected a corrupted mod file error in $LOG_FILENAME$. This usually happens because some mod files became corrupted during download or were corrupted initially. To fix the issue, press the button below and remove/reinstall all found corrupted mods.
warnings.ctov_without_lithostitched:
We detected that you are using the CTOV (ChoiceTheorem's Overhauled Village) mod without $LINK.LITHOSTITCHED$.
Technically, CTOV will work on its own, but it stops working as soon as other mods are involved.
If your modpack includes many mods, installing $LINK.LITHOSTITCHED$ should fix this issue.
warnings.curseforge_corrupted: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ that your Minecraft installation is corrupted by CurseForge. To fix it, follow the steps below: 1. Open your modpack folder. 2. Go up two levels. 3. Delete the Install folder. Another solution is switching to another launcher that doesn't have this issue, for example, $LINK.ATL$.
warnings.disk_space_ended: The error 'java.io.IOException: There is not enough space on the disk' in $LOG_FILENAME$ means: There was not enough space on the disk to complete an operation. You are running out of disk space! Clear some space to resolve the issue.
warnings.duplicated_mods: We detected an error at the end of $LOG_FILENAME$ about duplicated mods: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ To fix this crash, keep only one of the mods listed above.
warnings.epic_fight_addons: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ of missing Epic Fight mod classes, as the Epic Fight mod is currently installed. There are several addons and integration mods for Epic Fight that don't properly declare which version of Epic Fight they are made for. Go through all Epic Fight addons or mods adding integration and make sure they are compatible with the current version of Epic Fight. This may be a false alarm, so please double-check. To identify which mods are incompatible with your current version of the Epic Fight mod: Click the $LANG.gui.analysis.find_incompatible_epic_fight_addons$ button below. Wait for the analysis to complete, then you'll see a list of mods that are incompatible with the installed version of Epic Fight.
warnings.feature_order_cycle: We detected a feature order cycle error in $LOG_FILENAME$. This happens when Minecraft detects a circular dependency in world generation features, usually caused by multiple mods adding features in conflicting orders. The error typically occurs when you have multiple mods that modify world generation, like biome or structure mods, or any other worldgen features. To fix this issue, you can install the Feature Recycler mod that specifically addresses this problem: $LINK.FEATURE_RECYCLER$ This lightweight mod prevents crashes between world generation mods by resolving feature order conflicts automatically. While installing this mod will solve the problem, it is not a complete fix; you should report this issue to the authors of the conflicting mods.
warnings.ferritecore_neighbor_table: We detected this error in $LOG_FILENAME$: $ERROR_LINE$ To fix this issue: 1) Report the issue to $LINK.FERRITE_CORE_ISSUES$ 2) Open the config for the FerriteCore mod and set populateNeighborTable to false
warnings.geckolib_oculus_compat: Iris/Oculus & GeckoLib Compat ($JAR_NAME$) is no longer needed. Recent versions of GeckoLib (for Minecraft 1.20.1+) now natively support Iris/Oculus. This mod is doing nothing and is known to cause crashes; please consider removing it.
warnings.gpu_driver_issue: The $PROBLEMATIC_FRAME$ 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is part of the GPU driver. To fix it, follow these instructions: $LANG.warnings_common.drivers$
warnings.groovy_mod_loader_ipv6: We detected a GroovyModLoader (GML) IPv6 connection error in $LOG_FILENAME$. GML may not be able to download from Mojang's servers through IPv6. There are a few ways to solve this: 1) Press the $LANG.gui.analysis.gml_autofix.button$ button below (recommended) 2) Launch the game once with the -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true JVM argument 3) Disable IPv6 for the whole system by following this guide: $LINK.IPV6$ 4) Remove GML and its dependent mods; you can detect them all by clicking the second button below.
warnings.ig7icd64: The ig7icd64 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is part of the Intel integrated GPU driver. This happens if it is too old to be supported by Java itself. To fix this, try the following: 1) If you have a dedicated GPU, you need to configure your system to use it instead of the Intel integrated GPU on the CPU. Follow the steps below: $LINK.HOW_FORCE_APP_USE_DISCRETE_GPU$ 2) If you don't have a dedicated GPU and this integrated GPU is your only option, try updating your Intel Graphics Driver from here: $LINK.INTEL_DRIVERS$ 3) If you tried to use shaders, avoid doing so, as this integrated GPU is too old to support them. Some modpacks have shaders enabled by default; try removing the shaderpacks folder.
warnings.insufficient_memory: The There is insufficient memory... message in $LOG_FILENAME$ means that your system is running out of available physical RAM or swap space. To fix this: $FIRST_PRIORITY_WARNINGS$1) Make sure your memory is not heavily used by other running applications: check using Task Manager, and try to close unnecessary programs while playing Minecraft. 2) Ensure you are using the recommended memory settings for the modpack; perhaps your Xmx value is too high? 3) If you followed some dumb internet advice about disabling page files, revert it: that is likely the cause. Even if you had, for example, 128 GB of RAM, and most of it were free, Java would still need swap space to function properly. Find instructions on how to reenable page files below. 4) Check your disk space: there might not be enough space for the swap area, so you'll need to free up some. 5) Sometimes, simply restarting your computer can help clear out memory and reset swap usage. 6) If you're using more than the recommended memory for this pack, try lowering it. 7) If none of the above helps, $END_RECOMMENDATIONS$ How To Change Paging File Size: 1) In the Windows search bar, type 'Advanced System Settings' and open the first result. 2) Press the 'Settings' button located under the Performance section. 3) In the new section that just opened, press 'Advanced' and after press the 'Change' button under the 'Virtual Memory' section. 4) Check the 'Automatically manage paging file size for all drivers' checkbox.
warnings.insufficient_memory_indv: try the following: - Install the $LINK.FERRITE_CORE$ mod. - Install the $LINK.MODERN_FIX$ mod with dynamic_resources and deduplicate_location enabled. - Remove some mods to reduce Minecraft's RAM usage.
warnings.insufficient_memory_indv_1_12_2: try the following: - Install the $LINK.VINTAGE_FIX$ mod. - Install the $LINK.CENSORED_ASM$ mod. - Remove some mods to reduce Minecraft's RAM usage.
warnings.insufficient_memory.page_file_d:
0) We detected that paging files or swap space are disabled.
Follow the guide mentioned in step 3 to fix this.
warnings.integrated_gpu:
We detected that Minecraft is running on the integrated GPU, despite at least one available dedicated GPU!

Integrated GPU (currently used): $I_GPU$ Available dedicated GPU(s): $D_GPUS$ You will encounter poor performance and lag, unless you set Minecraft to run on the dedicated GPU. It is highly recommended to close Minecraft and switch to a dedicated GPU right now. You have a few options to fix this: 1) Press the $LANG.gui.integrated_gpu_autofix_button$ button below. 2) Alternatively, you can do the same by following this guide: $LINK.HOW_FORCE_APP_USE_DISCRETE_GPU$ 3) If you have a desktop (not a laptop), make sure your monitor cable is connected to the graphics card. Don't plug it into the motherboard ports (the ones next to USB)! Path to Java that is running Minecraft: $JAVA_PATH$
warnings.java_too_high: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ that this crash happened because the Java version is too high: $JAVA_VERSION$ Use the recommended version of Java for this version of Minecraft.
warnings.jemalloc: The jemalloc 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ indicates an issue with the jemalloc memory allocator. To resolve this, add the following argument to your JVM args: -Dorg.lwjgl.system.allocator=system
warnings.jvm: The jvm.dll 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ may be caused by several issues, including a hardware bug or a bug in the JVM itself. Please try the following steps in order: $FIRST_PRIORITY_WARNINGS$1) Have you encountered a warning about Intel 13th and 14th-generation processors? If you've experienced any system instability (BSODs, random app crashes), this is likely the cause. 2) If memory overclocking (XMP/DOCP/EXPO) is enabled, disable it, as it doesn't seem to work well with your system and may be causing memory corruption. Look for memory diagnostics instructions at the bottom of this message. 3) If you have done any overclocking, like downvolting or upvolting, try reverting it. 4) Apply the recommended JVM arguments for your modpack. 5) Test different Java versions or vendors, as the bug may be caused by the current JVM installation version or vendor. 6) Try reducing active CPU count with this JVM argument: -XX:ActiveProcessorCount=$HALF_OF_PROCESSORS$ 7) If none of the above helps, contact support. Memory diagnostics instructions: 1) Save this $LINK.RESULTS_OF_MEMORY_DIAGNOSTICS$. It will be needed to get results of diagnostics after reboot. 2) Press Windows + R to open the Run dialog box, enter mdsched and click OK. 3) In the Windows Memory Diagnostic window, click the Restart now and check for problems option. If you don't see a popup with the results after reboot, refer to the instructions on how to view them. Please note: this test may not detect every memory issue, nor can it assert that this is the cause of the JVM crash. Disabling memory overclocking is still the best first step.
warnings.jvm.17_0_8: 0) We detected that the Java version that is running this instance of Minecraft is 17.0.8, which is known to have an issue. Before trying the steps below, try switching to Java 21. You can download it from $LINK.ADOPTIUM_JDK$ Warning: some launchers like CurseForge won't allow you to use Java 21 to run Minecraft versions designed for Java 17; in such cases, we recommend switching to another launcher, such as $LINK.ATL$
warnings.kubejs_datapack: We detected a KubeJS error in $LOG_FILENAME$: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ If this happened with an unmodified modpack, it most likely means your installation is corrupted. Please reinstall the modpack. If you are creating a modpack, the issue is most likely caused by a datapack applied through KubeJS. Read the error message carefully to fix the issue.
warnings.language_provider_mismatch: We detected a language provider mismatch in $LOG_FILENAME$: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ To fix this issue, read the message above carefully, and either update Forge to the requested version, or, if Forge versions for this Minecraft version are outside the requested range, that means the mod mentioned is designed for a different Minecraft version.
warnings.legacy_too_many_ids: We detected a 'too many ids' error in $LOG_FILENAME$. This error is known to happen on legacy versions because the maximum number of IDs for items or blocks is limited to 4096. Installing many mods that add many items or blocks will definitely cause this issue. Solutions: 1. Install $MOD_LINK$. This mod is specifically built to fix this issue. 2. Remove some mods that add many blocks or items. It is strongly recommended to use the first solution.
warnings.lib_gl_programmability: The libGLProgrammability.dylib 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is caused by a bug in Apple's in-house OpenGL driver; this blocks many advanced shader packs from working on macOS. Apple makes all the drivers in-house; fixes only arrive via macOS updates. You are most likely using a shader pack incompatible with macOS. Disable shaders or switch to a shader pack compatible with macOS. Note: This has been an issue since 2021, so it is most likely still not fixed.
warnings.libglfw_so: The libglfw.so 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is a typical Linux problem. To fix it, follow the steps below: 1. Download the latest GLFW library files from your distro's official repositories. If you are on a distro with slower updates (like Ubuntu), download the latest pre-built files from this $LINK.GLFW_DOWNLOAD$ instead 2. Add -Dorg.lwjgl.glfw.libname=/path/to/file to your launcher JVM arguments. For example, this might look something like this: -Dorg.lwjgl.glfw.libname=/home/frontear/Downloads/libglfw.so. $LANG.warnings_common.so_vm_options$
warnings.libopenal_so: The libopenal.so 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is a typical Linux problem. To fix it, follow the steps below: 1. Download the latest OpenAL library files from your distro's official repositories. 2. Add -Dorg.lwjgl.openal.libname=/usr/lib/libopenal.so to your launcher JVM arguments. This path might differ depending on your distro, so please double-check. $LANG.warnings_common.so_vm_options$
warnings.macjdk: The v ~StubRoutines::SafeFetch32 'Problematic Frame' error in $LOG_FILENAME$ is caused by an issue with the bundled Java runtime ('Microsoft' build version 17.0.8 and newer) on Apple Silicon (M1/M2/etc.) CPUs, which causes Java to crash under certain conditions. To resolve this issue, you first need to install a different Java runtime: 1. Click $LINK.AZUL_DOWNLOAD$ to get the recommended Java version for your system. 2. Hover over the Download button and click '.dmg' to download the installer. 3. Open the downloaded file and follow the installation instructions. Next, you need to configure your Minecraft launcher to use the newly installed Java. The following instructions are for $LINK.ATL$ and may vary for other launchers: 1. Click 'Settings' on the right. 2. Select 'Java/Minecraft' at the top. 3. Uncheck 'Use Java Provided by Minecraft'. 4. Manually enter the following Java path in the 'Java Install Location' text box: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/zulu-21.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java
warnings.missing_class_common: This issue can occur for one of the following reasons: 1) A mod depends on another one that is missing. 2) A mod requires a different version of another one that provides this class. To find which mod(s) rely on the missing class, press the button below. You can then remove them or read their descriptions to see which dependencies to install. If all required dependencies are already installed, try experimenting with their versions. Sometimes, you can identify the missing dependency just by the class name. For example, the class com/cupboard/config/ICommonConfig belongs to the mod 'Cupboard'.
warnings.missing_embeddium_for_oculus: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ that you are missing $LINK.EMBEDDIUM$ for Oculus. Installing the $LINK.EMBEDDIUM$ mod will fix your issue.
warnings.missing_indium: We detected in $LOG_FILENAME$ that you are missing the $LINK.INDIUM$ mod. Sodium versions earlier than 0.6.0 don't include compatibility with other mods; this is provided by the $LINK.INDIUM$ mod. Adding the $LINK.INDIUM$ mod will resolve this crash.
warnings.missing_unsupported_dependencie: We detected a dependency conflict in $LOG_FILENAME$: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ To fix this issue, read the message above carefully and try to resolve all conflicts. Map of mod IDs to JAR names involved (for reference only): $MOD_IDS_TO_JAR_NAMES$
warnings.mixin_apply: Mixin config $CONFIG$ from mod $MOD$ couldn't be applied.
warnings.mixin_apply_common_end: This analysis is in beta; it may cause false positives, but that is extremely unlikely. This issue may happen because of one of the following reasons: 1) Some mods are incompatible with each other. 2) Some mods that add compatibility are broken due to changes in the target mods. 3) Some mods are designed for a different version of Minecraft or loader. 4) You have 2 mods named differently, but they're actually the same mod. 5) A mod is just broken. To fix the issue, you have a few options: 1) Remove the faulting mod. 2) Experiment with different versions if it is a compatibility issue.
warnings.mixin_apply_common_start: We detected an error in $LOG_FILENAME$ about applying a mixin config.
warnings.mixin_apply_conflicting:
Mixin config $CONFIG$ from mod $MOD$ couldn't be applied due to conflicts with
mixin config $CONFIG_2$ from mod $MOD_2$
warnings.mixin_apply_conflicting_with_ja:
Mixin config $CONFIG$ from mod $MOD$ couldn't be applied due to conflicts with
mod $MOD_2$
warnings.mixin_apply_java_version:
Mixin config $CONFIG$ from mod $MOD$ couldn't be applied
because it was compiled for $REQUIRED_JAVA_VERSION$, but the current runtime is $CURRENT_JAVA_VERSION$.

Run Minecraft with $REQUIRED_JAVA_VERSION$ or newer, or remove the mod.
warnings.mixin_apply_missing_class:
A mixin config couldn't be applied because a required class is missing: $MISSING_CLASS$
$LANG.warnings.missing_class_common$
warnings.mixin_apply_missing_class_auto_: Find the mod(s) that depend on this missing class
warnings.mixin_config_missing_or_corrupt:
Mixin config $CONFIG$ from mod $MOD$ couldn't be applied because it is corrupted or missing.
Usually this means the mod or a recent update is broken, or the mod file is corrupted.
If reinstalling the mod doesn't fix it, try removing the mod.
warnings.modernifx_watchdog: We detected a message at the end of $LOG_FILENAME$ from the IntegratedWatchdog about a server tick taking way longer than it should have: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ If you were not doing something extremely demanding, like using WorldEdit to change trillions of blocks, this likely means the Integrated Server has deadlocked. A deadlock happens when parts of the game are waiting for each other and preventing anything from continuing, like a traffic jam where every car is blocking another. To fix this crash, check the thread dump at the end of the log: it shows which parts of the game were waiting for each other. This can be hard to understand without technical knowledge. You can try using some advanced reasoning LLM to analyze the thread dump; it may help identify the mod causing the issue. If this happened in an unmodified modpack, please report it to the developers: it shouldn't happen.
warnings.module_find: We detected an error in $LOG_FILENAME$ about a missing package: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ This error indicates that the mod is either missing a dependency, needs a different version of a dependency, or is just broken. It is also possible that this was caused by 2 mods requiring different versions of the same dependency in jarInJar, which would mean the mods are incompatible. You have a few ways to fix this crash: 1) Visit the mod page and check which dependencies are required. Try installing or updating them. 2) If the mod works alone, it is most likely a conflict with another mod. 3) If nothing helps, you can remove the mod. Mods that ship the mentioned package: $JARS$
warnings.module_resolution: We detected an error in $LOG_FILENAME$ about duplicated packages: $LINE_FROM_LOG$ This error means mods are exporting packages with the same name to the game, while only one can be loaded. Basically, this either means the same mod is present twice, or there is a dependency conflict. You have 2 ways to fix this crash: 1) [RECOMMENDED SOLUTION] Keep only one of the mods listed below, and report the issue to both mod authors. They should relocate it or use jarInJar for their dependencies. 2) [TEMPORARY FIX] This is not recommended: it sometimes works, sometimes doesn't, and can cause unexpected issues. Open the mod as an archive and delete the '$PACKAGE$' folder in all mods listed below except one. Mods containing the mentioned package: $JARS$
warnings.neo_version1_20_1:
You are either playing a very outdated version of MinecraftForge, or using NeoForge on 1.20.1.
Both are known to cause many issues and crashes.
If you are playing Neo, the official documentation says to switch back to Forge, as Neo has dropped support for 1.20.1 and focused on newer versions.
If you are playing MinecraftForge, update the modloader to recent versions.
Newer builds of Forge also have improved performance or are better optimised.
warnings.nvoglv64: The nvoglv64 'Problematic frame' in $LOG_FILENAME$ is part of the Nvidia driver for the GPU. This can be an issue with your current Nvidia card driver. Try fresh reinstalling your drivers from $LINK.NVIDIA_DRIVERS$
warnings.optifine: A long time ago, OptiFine used to be the go-to solution to make your game better, faster, and stronger through various useful features and optimizations, but things have changed. Currently, OptiFine is incompatible with A LOT of mods, and this crash was most likely caused by one of these issues. There is no longer a good reason to use it: other open-source projects offer better performance, significantly improved compatibility, and full shader support. Read this article and consider switching to the alternatives: $LINK.OPTIFINE_ALTERNATIVES$ If you are playing a modpack, it is often already well-optimized; you just need to remove OptiFine.
warnings.out_of_memory_error: The java.lang.OutOfMemoryError message in $LOG_FILENAME$ means that not enough memory is allocated for Minecraft to keep running. $LANG.warnings_common.memory_args$ Look up the recommended memory settings for this modpack and allocate more memory. If you're sure you've allocated enough RAM, $END_RECOMMENDATIONS$
warnings.resource_location_exception: We detected signs in $LOG_FILENAME$ of a resource location error: $LINE_FROM_LOG$. This typically happens when Minecraft tries to load a resource (such as a block, item, or texture) using a name that contains invalid characters. This is most often caused by one of the following reasons: 1) Non-English system language settings. In such cases, the resource location may include a Unicode symbol in this format: \u0131n. To fix this, add the following JVM arguments to force the game to use English locale settings: -Duser.language=en -Duser.region=US 2) A mod has incorrectly handled a resource location. Try removing the mod that added this faulty resource. It is strongly recommended to try the first solution before resorting to the second one.
warnings.rubidium:
Rubidium is an abandoned mod with numerous bugs and stability issues. There is no reason to use it.
Please switch to $LINK.EMBEDDIUM$,
 a fork that continues its development and is actively maintained.
It is highly likely that Rubidium specifically caused this crash.
warnings.server_config_corrupted: We detected a serverconfig corruption error in $LOG_FILENAME$. Corrupted config: $CONFIG_FILE$ from mod: $MOD_ID$ To fix the issue, go to saves/world (where 'world' is the name of your world) and delete the serverconfig folder. The problematic config will be regenerated with default settings or from the serverconfig folder in the root of the modpack on the next world join. We recommend deleting the whole serverconfig folder because this issue is known to often happen with multiple configs.
warnings.unsupported_class_version: We detected an error in $LOG_FILENAME$ about a mod compiled with a newer Java version. The class $CLASS_NAME$ was compiled for Java $COMPILED_VERSION$, but you are launching the game with Java $RUNTIME_VERSION$. To fix this crash, you have the following options: 1) Launch the game with Java $COMPILED_VERSION$ or newer. 2) Remove the following mod files that require Java $COMPILED_VERSION$. $CLASS_NAME$ class comes from: $JARS$
warnings.used_by_another_process: We detected a file access error in $LOG_FILENAME$. The $CONFIG_FILE$ config file is locked by another process. Solutions: 1. If another instance of the game is running, close it 2. If you opened it in file editor, close the editor 3. If nothing helps, reboot your system
warnings.version1_21:
Minecraft version 1.21 contains security flaws, so it has been abandoned and is no longer supported.
It is very likely that this crash is caused by the abandoned version.
Developers of both loaders and mods stopped releasing updates for it almost immediately after version 1.21.1 was released.
It is recommended to upgrade to version 1.21.1.
